metadata.name: The Emptiness Of Space
metadata.description:
Chroma Code uses photography & A.I generated pieces that are often composited/modified using image editing software, then sent through an analog signal chain via conversion, which renders the edited image directly onto a CRT TV manufactured between the year(s) 1990 & 2002.

The signal chain consists of converters, modulators, circuit bent modules, & guitar pedals â€” all of which are working in tangent to color-grade, warp & manipulate the artwork displayed on the CRT TV. Each piece is then resampled in 4K using a DSLR camera, which captures the footage directly from the TV screen & is then imported into a video editing software for fine tuning & re-sizing.

This is a simplified explanation of the process.

Video Size: 2000 x 2000 px  
TV Model & Year: Sylvania, 2002
